message: And right now, the atmosphere in this classroom couldn’t be more compromised.

name: Shingo
message: “...Hmmm.”
The second-year test class, 2-T, comprising the students selected from Kagamidai and Yuihime.
I can’t find any calm in the grand, spacious classroom, and the air is so prickly it hurts.

name: Kagamidai Boy A
message: “Morning—uwah?!”
One of my friends opens the door and immediately freezes up under multiple unwelcoming looks.
The Yuihime girls, mistresses of the withering looks, then start to whisper among themselves.
The Kagamidai girls wriggle uncomfortably.

name: Shingo
message: “...Oh, man.”
I give a quiet sigh.
This is how it’s been the entire time. Every incoming boy is given this frosty welcome.
The air feels so heavy, and cold, and oppressive. It just makes me want to open a window.
I find myself looking in that direction.
But I’m not really thinking of a real window. I’m trying to think of a metaphorical window for this situation.
Which would be—her. Airi Sena. From that night in the park.
I’ve learned plenty about her already. She seems to hold a key position among the selected Yuihime students.
That said, she isn’t in an actual leadership position. Not like Hayata.
But she’s an adept student. Serious, smart, elegant, the embodiment of the image of Yuihime.
She’s even the daughter of the principal.
All of the Yuihime girls look to her. I can see that.
—The events in the auditorium yesterday made it clear to everyone from Kagamidai that she is dead set against the merger.
Not every girl at Yuihime feels the same way, but they also feel they should defer to Sena.
Everyone follows her lead, looking to her. That’s why things are so uncomfortable here this morning.
Sena seems a little uncomfortable with this reality herself, but she’s also just sitting quietly in her seat, so it’s hard to say for sure.
I’m unable to put up with this any longer. I stand up and proceed over to Sena.
I know the entire class is watching.
The tension in the air mounts. But I walk all the way over to her and speak.

name: Shingo
message: “Good morning, Sena...”
Sena’s eyebrows knit a little. She looks up at me like that for a few seconds.

name: Airi
message: “...Good morning, Uryu.”
It’s like I hear a collective sigh of relief from around the classroom.
Sena then looks away, seemingly choosing to ignore me.
—Uryu, huh.
That seems to be the best she can do right now.
While thinking about stubborn windows that can’t be opened, I leave it at the greeting and return to my seat.
The atmosphere has loosened up a little. It feels more “normal” than before.

name: Shingo
message: “Phew...”
I stop.

name: Ange
message: “I mean, we saw this coming, but the going looks tough ahead, Shingo.”

name: Shingo
message: “Uwah! Are you trying to give me a heart attack?!”
It’s not just her suddenly talking to me—she’s dressed as a maid, which compounds the surprise.

name: Ange
message: “Airi is so stubborn. Once she gets like that, it’s going to be hard to talk her down.”

name: Shingo
message: “...Hey, Ange.”

name: Ange
message: “Good morning. Another fine day ahead.”
Ange gives me a charming greeting.
The atmosphere in the classroom just rolls off her—it’s like she has her own climate.
I mean, look how she’s dressed.

name: Shingo
message: “...Still rocking the maid outfit today.”

name: Ange
message: “Yes. I wear my maid getup every day. Because I am a maid!”
That explains that.
She is a student (and one selected for the test class), but the principal has given her special dispensation to dress as a maid. Because, after all—she is a maid.

name: Ange
message: “I am a maid, like Mumsie before me.”

name: Shingo
message: “Your mother? Is she from—Europe, I’m guessing?”

name: Ange
message: “Yes. From England. That makes me half English.”

name: Ange
message: “Although I’m very Japanese! Ahaha. My favorite food is tokoroten, you should try it sometime.”
I’m not sure what to do with all of this, coming from such a picture of a maid.

name: Ange
message: “But I have to say, Shingo, the students don’t seem very relaxed right now.”

name: Shingo
message: “Yeah. We aren’t there yet.”

name: Ange
message: “That’s where I come in!”
With that, Ange dashes out into the corridor, and then comes back with a cart.
She begins to serve tea to everyone at an astounding rate.

name: Ange
message: “I’ve made some tea! You want some, correct? I’ve got tea here, tea for everyone!”
She really is fast!
She’s served tea to everyone in the class in a flash, without kicking up a mote of dust or ruffing her skirt.

name: Ange
message: “You want some too, Shingo? Please, I insist! Here you go.”

name: Shingo
message: “Thanks. You’re really something, Ange.”

name: Ange
message: “Hehe, this is what a maid does. I’m serious about my profession.”

name: Ange
message: “Allow me to take my leave. If you need anything else, please don’t hesitate to speak up!”
She gives me a proud smile, her bust heaving, and then leaves.
She really is a maid. The whole getup isn’t just for show.

name: Shingo
message: “Wow... this tea is really good, too.”
Okay. In any case—

name: Kagamidai Girl A
message: “Thanks, Ange, for serving tea to everyone, including us.”

name: Kagamidai Girl B
message: “We’re not... in the way here, are we?”

name: Ange
message: “No, of course not. The more the merrier, where I’m concerned.”

name: Ange
message: “It simply means more candidates to eventually become my master—or mistress.”

name: Kagamidai Girl A
message: “Right. You’re a masterless maid, aren’t you Ange.”

name: Ange
message: “That is correct! Hahaha. A maid without a master, I’m embarrassed to say.”

name: Ange
message: “I’m in the middle of searching for someone to serve, but it isn’t going especially well.”
—Ange doesn’t seem particularly opposed to the merger.
She might not be welcoming it with open arms, but she’s at least being pleasant about it from her neutral position.
It’s reassuring to have someone like her around.

name: Ange
message: “Do you like the tea?”

name: Kagamidai Boy B
message: “Yeah, it’s perfect. Sluuuurp...”

name: Yuihime Girl B
message: “How uncouth! This is why I don’t want the merger, provisional or otherwise.”

name: Ange
message: “Hahaha, this isn’t easy for you, is it, Eiko! I’ve never seen such a look on your face.”
Although it could be that she’s just making the most of this uncomfortable atmosphere.
Maybe that quirky personality is why she can’t find someone to hire her?

name: Sana
message: “It’s not easy, but I think just accepting it is the kindest thing to do.”

name: Ange
message: “Oh, Sanny! You’re so mature. I’m moved to tears over here.”

name: Sana
message: “Thanks. You go ahead. Just relax and enjoy that tea.”

name: Kagamidai Boy B
message: “Thank you, Inui.”

name: Sana
message: “Don’t mention it.”

name: Macchi
message: “Good morning, everyone. Nice to see you all getting along—both sexes, I mean.”
It isn’t just Ange. Some people have been welcoming to us, like the two from the auditorium—Macchi Yatsuzuka (our homeroom teacher, it turns out) and Sana Inui.
The atmosphere is harsh at the moment, but it doesn’t mean everyone is against the merger.

name: Shingo
message: “That’s right.”
But then—

name: Macchi
message: “Sena, how are you today? Are you getting along?”

name: Airi
message: “Ms. Yatsuzuka, can you please start the homeroom now?”

name: Macchi
message: “Uh... yes, of course.”
—The biggest, clearest problem is Sena. She has the greatest control over the climate of this classroom.

name: Macchi
message: “That’s the end of homeroom for today. Please, everyone, try and be nice to each other. Okay...”
With the end of homeroom, Sena leaves the classroom with her serene mask intact.
All the guys in the classroom instantly relax.
I watch her go, and even I give a sigh.

name: Hayata
message: “What’s up, Shingo?”
This from Hayata.

name: Shingo
message: “...You’ve been keeping your mouth shut.”

name: Hayata
message: “I mean, I’m enjoying all this immensely, is all.”
Hayata can handle the ups and downs at his own sweet pace, so he’s not struggling with this at all.
Hearing that, and seeing the smile on his face, almost makes me want to agree with him.

name: Hayata
message: “But you’ve been holding out on me, Shingo. You know her, right? You and Sakuno. You should talk to her more.”

name: Shingo
message: “I mean... we only met her once.”
That’s even one of the reasons that makes it harder to talk to her, if I’m honest, but I keep that to myself.

name: Shingo
message: “Having met her just before all this happened actually makes things more complicated.”
She was so friendly and warm when we talked in the park, but I haven’t seen a single flash of that since being reunited here at school.
My impression of her from that first meeting is what makes it harder for me to deal with this new version of her.
—On top of that, all she currently means to me is being a new friend for my sister.

name: Hayata
message: “Hmmm. Is that so?”

name: Shingo
message: “The only way through this mess is by talking it out.”

name: Hayata
message: “I look forward to seeing how that goes.”

name: Shingo
message: “...You almost make it sound like you don’t plan on helping out.”

name: Hayata
message: “I’m headed back to Kagamidai partway through today. I wish you the best of luck, my brother!”

name: Shingo
message: “Hold on! You’re not even going to be here? You won’t be seeing anything!”

name: Hayata
message: “You’ll find being class president is more restrictive than it is liberating. Such are the burdens of leadership.”

name: Shingo
message: “You swine!”
Hayata really did proceed to leave for Kagamidai, and I was left—unable to withstand the atmosphere in the classroom—to head out into the corridor.
That calms me down, while the elegance of the setting soothes me...

name: Shingo
message: “...Maybe I’ll head to the bathroom too.”
Once I’ve left, it’s pathetic, but I simply don’t want to go back inside. That’s how hard the atmosphere in there is on me.

name: Shingo
message: “But you know what...”
I think as I walk.
Sena. A girl I met on the last night of September.
She’s got an attitude at the moment, but she’s not a bad person. I can believe that, based on our meeting that night.
There are reasons for how she’s acting now, justified or otherwise...
But even if there’s a gap between us, it’s still an advantage that we met before this. It all comes back to one thing.

name: Shingo
message: “...We need to talk. About all sorts of things, we just need to talk.”
I’m still thinking as I head into the bathroom.

name: Airi
message: “Huh?”

name: Shingo
message: “Ah.”
Sena is already in there.
My head hits pause for a moment.

name: Shingo
message: “Hey, okay, Sena, I know how this looks...”
Sena’s attractive face slowly fills up with red.

name: Airi
message: %164;“Get out!”

name: Shingo
message: “Uwaaah!”
Of course, I react immediately and leap back out.

name: Shingo
message: “Oh man, what am I thinking? I’m not thinking, am I!”
In Kagamidai, that was the location of the boys’ bathroom.
But this is Yuihime. There are—essentially—only girls’ bathrooms here.
The boys had been told to use the bathroom in a separate building yesterday, but it slipped my mind.

name: Shingo
message: “And I just had to bump into Sena inside there too! Oh boy!”

name: Ange
message: “You’re a bold one, Shingo, barging in on girl in the bathroom with such a straight face!”
And Ange saw me too!

name: Shingo
message: “Hey, Ange, about all this...”

name: Ange
message: “That voice was Airi, correct? Are you okay in there? Chastity intact?”
I’m really sweating it now.
Sena emerges, red to her ears, with her eyebrows as furrowed as a ploughed field.

name: Shingo
message: “Sena. I’m so sorry!”
I start with an apology. That seem the best idea. It’s really all I can do.
Thank goodness she wasn’t in the middle of anything, at least—\k%123;but I’m still in trouble!

name: Shingo
message: “I’m sorry, I don’t know what I was thinking! I mean, I wasn’t thinking! I’m sorry, Sena, I’m sorry!”
But Sena won’t even look at me.

name: Ange
message: “Airi. We should confer with the student council or Ranka about the washrooms issue. We need a location officially designated for the boys to use, for a start.”

name: Airi
message: “...Indeed. Who knows what the next thoughtless male might walk in upon.”

name: Shingo
message: “Hey—”

name: Airi
message: “Ange, we’re going!”

name: Ange
message: “Yes, right with you! ♪ Shingo, just because we are leaving you alone, that doesn’t mean you can use the girls’ bathroom, okay?”
Sena smashes me with a final withering look, and then sets off with Ange in tow.
...Oh boy.
—Honestly.
To say we are coming into a girls’ school, they really didn’t think about what adding boys to the mix was going to require.

name: Shingo
message: “There’s no boys’ changing room either!”
We’re heading back from gym class.
The boys had been left to get changed anywhere they could, away from prying eyes, and I’m leading the discourse on the subject.
...If Hayata had been here, this would have been his time to shine, but no dice there.
I need to get all the boys on the same page before we return to the classroom.

name: Kagamidai Boy A
message: “I know. But everyone other than us are, well—girls.”

name: Shingo
message: “Right. So we need to do our best to blend in, without making waves.”
I clench my fist in a unifying gesture as I open the door.

name: Shingo
message: “Huh?”
High-pitched screams assault my ears, and I get a glimpse of—skin?
%164;Someone getting changed?!

name: Shingo
message: “Uwaaah, I’m sorry!”
I hurriedly close the door again, and then freeze up.
I mean, this is how things have always been here, sure.
But I wish they could give us some consideration too!

name: Shingo
message: “Ulp!”
The door suddenly opens, and something soft hits me in the face—

name: Airi
message: “...Uryu.”
I leap away in panic!
There’s Sena (thankfully in her #00ff0000;full uniform#;) with an icy expression (although flushed red) glaring right at me.

name: Airi
message: “...This one was partly on me, I will admit.”

name: Shingo
message: “I really am sorry! But please—”

name: Airi
message: “You could at least knock! I’m starting to see your character, Uryu, but can you not stand right in front of the door?”
The guys all proceed to slap me on the back.

name: Kagamidai Boy A
message: “You won’t get any sympathy out of me, after all the stuff you’ve been seeing today.”

name: Shingo
message: “Hey, hold on!”
During lessons.

name: Yuihime Girl B
message: “I heard Uryu was the one leading the gang of peepers...”
The most important thing I’ve learned today is—always knock.
I mean, I would normally knock... but I’d never have expected a girl to be changing in there.

name: Shingo
message: %51;“They had to know the guys were coming back... they could show a little more caution.”
I almost feel like speaking up, but that’s coming from having attended a school with both sexes.
I need to get my head together and try not to purchase the wrath of the girls again.

name: Airi
message: “—Which is why I think this sentence has two possible meanings.”
Sena really is a good student; I’ll give her that.
The teachers must love her. The refined way she answers their questions, she’s like the ideal student.
—Which only makes all this more difficult.
To make things worse, I even bumped right into her before. I need to try and put this right...
Luckily, we are sitting in the same row, and not that far apart. If I can just—
Then something rolls up to my feet.

name: Kagamidai Boy B
message: %51;“Sorry, Uryu, I dropped my eraser down there...”

name: Shingo
message: %51;“No problem, give me a sec to limber up.”
I bend my body down and stick my head under the desk.
From here, I can see Sena’s smooth legs.
...This could be taken the wrong way too.
I hurriedly get my face back above sea level.
...Sena is looking angrily in my direction, pressing down on her skirt with both hands.

name: Airi
message: “Uryu!”

name: Shingo
message: “An eraser! A classmate dropped his eraser!”
—The second lesson of the day.
No leaning below desk level in class.
With each and every fresh incident, I can only renew my resolve to take even greater care going forward.

name: Airi
message: “Uryu...”

name: Shingo
message: “Please, stay calm, stay calm and just listen to me...”

name: Kagamidai Boy A
message: “Ah, I’m sorry, I’m sorry, Uryu!”
But this isn’t something that’s so easily changed, and we continue to cause upsets on the regular.
Eventually—

name: Shingo
message: “Okay, that wasn’t a great showing from me. But can you please take some care too? Is that too much to ask?”

name: Airi
message: “So now you’re shaming me to make a point!”
Sena, the leader of the Yuihime girls, also often ended up as the one embarrassed by our antics.
The way she looks at us, it’s gone from “hostile” to a “blistering stare of death!”
We finally make it lunchtime. I leave the classroom and wander the corridors.
I don’t really have anywhere to go. I still don’t know the campus. But being in the classroom is just wearing me out.

name: Shingo
message: “It feels like the atmosphere is just getting worse, not better.”
That might be thanks to me, of course, but it still wears me out.
This isn’t really working out.
I just keep walking around, rather than going back.
The sound of my footfalls in the cold, detached corridor only makes me feel it more intensely.

name: Shingo
message: “How many times did I hear that cold ‘Uryu’ from Sena today?”
—And then I hear another one.
“Uryu...”
“Ryu... ryu, uryu...”
I can hear a voice calling me from somewhere.

name: Shingo
message: “...Who’s there?”
In response (?) to my call, the mysterious creature from the courtyard yesterday now reveals itself.
“Ryu?”
I kneel down and say hello, without thinking.
I had to stay away from animals when I was younger, due to my asthma, but now I quite like them.
That said... getting a closer, longer look at this thing, it really is totally bizarre.
“Uryu...”

name: Shingo
message: “...Yeah.”
I keep replying to it, though. The sounds it makes really do sound like my surname.
“Ryu? Ryu...”

name: Shingo
message: “Okay... I’m Uryu. Shingo Uryu.”
“Ryu?”

name: Shingo
message: “Yes. Uryu.”
“Uryu!”
Hop!
“Ryu, ryu! ♪”
The mysterious creature hops up onto me, then starts rubbing me with its body. It seems pretty pleased.
“Ryu!”
...It seems to like me.
I decide to continue my stroll, taking the creature with me.
Whether it likes me or not, I didn’t want to just leave it there.
And it literally sounds like it’s calling my name. That has to mean something.

name: Shingo
message: “You really are so fluffy. It’s kinda nice.”
“Ryu, ryu.”

name: Shingo
message: “Yes, of course. And what about that girl who was with you before? Where’s she today?”
“Ryu?”

name: Shingo
message: “You don’t know?”

name: Shingo
message: “I see...”
“Ryu!”
It kinda feels like we’re communicating, which is also a strange feeling.
But I do wonder where the girl who was playing with this creature can be found.
Even if it isn’t her pet, specifically, she can surely tell me more about it.

name: Shingo
message: “...She looked kinda small, but is she a student here?”
“Uryu.”

name: Shingo
message: “You don’t know?”
“Ryu!”

name: Shingo
message: “Uryu is my name, Uryu.”
I keep hold of the creature and continue my walk.

name: Shingo
message: “Ah, you can get out the back through here.”
“Panditty!”

name: Shingo
message: “Huh?”
As I head out behind the school, I hear a voice shouting what sounds like random words.
“Panditty, where are you?”
“Ryu!”
As soon as it hears that call, the creature in my arms starts to react.
“Ryu! Ryu!”

name: Shingo
message: “Ah, this voice. It must be the girl I’m looking for.”
“Ryu, uryu!”
“Panditty!”
As I expected, it’s the same small girl who shows up.
Her big eyes get even wider when she sees me holding the creature.

name: Shingo
message: “Hey there...”
“Ah, hi, ah... who are you?”
“Ryu.”

name: Shingo
message: “No. Uryu, my name is Uryu.”
“Huh?”

name: Shingo
message: “Ah, you see... I’m called Shingo Uryu.”
“Uryu!”

name: Shingo
message: “That’s right.”
“Hah... aha, hahaha!”
The girl starts laughing her head off.
She has a smooth, round, appealing laugh. That’s what strikes me about her first.
After taking the creature from me, she looks up into my face and then gives me a sweet candy laugh.

name: Miu
message: “Thanks, Uryu. I’m Miu Amaha, a third year.”
A third year?!
I’m shocked by this information but do my best to keep that off my face.
It’s a damn good thing I’m always polite when meeting someone for the first time.

name: Miu
message: “Yep, I’m older than you. You must be a first or second year, correct?”

name: Shingo
message: “Ah, yes, that’s right... I’m a second year. From 2-T.”

name: Miu
message: “Sorry to gender profile you, but I thought as much. One of the early merger kids from Kagamidai. We third years don’t have a test class.”
She looks up at me again and smiles.
She looks so young; I’m shocked again to hear she is in her third year here.
She’s small and cute and all very fluffy, sure, but there’s also definitely a collected, “older sister” vibe to her.
She might be small, but her body is definitely feminine, too.
Of course, I’m not looking too hard at that. I do try to be a gentleman.

name: Miu
message: “Hmmm, I see...”
Amaha, meanwhile, starts to circle around me, her eyes glittering.

name: Shingo
message: “Is there... something you want?”

name: Miu
message: “Ah, sorry.”
She immediately stops and then gives an embarrassed laugh.

name: Miu
message: “This has always been a girls’ school. It’s something new to talk to a boy.”
And her reaction is new for me, having always been at a school with all genders.
“Ryu, ryu!”

name: Miu
message: “Hehe, Panditty, you’re a girl too. Being held by a cool young man like Uryu must have been something quite different for you!”
“Uryu!”

name: Shingo
message: “That thing is female?!”
I ignore being called “cool” and look at the mysterious creature resting on Amaha’s head.

name: Shingo
message: “I see. I’m sorry. Maybe I should have been gentler.”
“Ryu? Uryu! ♪”

name: Shingo
message: “That’s right. I’m Uryu.”

name: Miu
message: “Ahaha...”
It seems the back-and-forth between me and this creature, revolving around so much “uryu,” is really tickling Amaha.

name: Miu
message: “Panditty seems to have really taken a liking to you too.”
Amaha takes the mysterious creature down, holds her tight, and then tickles her beneath what, at least on a cat, might be considered her chin.
...I really can’t tell, to be honest.

name: Miu
message: “Hehe.”

name: Shingo
message: “She’s called ‘Panditty?’ Is she... a cat?”
Every cat across the country would probably take offense at my question, but I feel I have to ask.

name: Miu
message: “She’s not a cat, but a Panditty. She’s like a panda, like a kitty, poof, Panditty.”
Amaha makes it sound like this is the most natural thing in the world.

name: Shingo
message: “...Okay, but... what kind of animal is that exactly?”

name: Miu
message: “I’m not entirely sure—biologically speaking. But she’s super cute! Right, Panditty?”
She’s not a particularly precise person.

name: Shingo
message: “Okay, well... nice to meet you, Panditty. I hope we can be friends.”

name: Panditty
message: “Ryu, ryu! ♪”
I give her a patting and Panditty wriggles happily.
It seems she really has taken a liking to me.

name: Miu
message: “You two look like good friends already!”

name: Miu
message: “I hope we can be friends too, Uryu.”

name: Shingo
message: “Huh?”
I don’t give the best reaction, caught off guard by this unexpected development.
Amaha gives me a gentle smile.

name: Miu
message: “It might be tough until you get accustomed to things, but this is a good school. I’m sure you’ll learn to love it here.”

name: Miu
message: “I’m happy to have you here, Uryu. Let’s be friends.”

name: Shingo
message: “Amaha...”
Her smile warms my heart, in a way I can’t describe.

name: Miu
message: “I’m jealous of the girls in the first and second years. All those new friends.”

name: Panditty
message: “Ryu.”
Amaha seems very welcoming to our presence here.
Unlike Sena and most of the girls in our class, she’s accepting of the Kagamidai contingent—including the boys.

name: Shingo
message: “Thank you!”
I give her a deep bow.
After how hard the morning has been, the attitude displayed by Amaha is exactly what I needed.
She also seems to have sensed something.
Amaha stands up on her toes and gently pats me on the head.

name: Miu
message: “Good boy, good boy.”
It’s actually strangely soothing.
A warm and happy feeling spreads inside my chest.
—Her hand slowly moves away.

name: Shingo
message: “...Amaha.”

name: Miu
message: “Hehehe.”

name: Miu
message: “...You’d better get back to class or you’ll miss your lunch.”

name: Shingo
message: “Ah... yeah, thanks.”
A feeling hits me like I’ve just been rudely woken up. I hurriedly collect myself.

name: Shingo
message: “...I’d better get going.”

name: Miu
message: “Okay. See you soon, Uryu. Panditty, say goodbye too!”

name: Panditty
message: “Uryu! ♪”
Amaha sees me off with a smile and a wave.
Wow. The ups and downs in this place are giving me whiplash.

name: Kagamidai Boy A
message: “Hey, where have you been. Uryu?”
I return to the classroom, fired up to get back into things, and the boys all cluster around me.

name: Kagamidai Boy A
message: “Mukunashi isn’t here today. We need you around to pad our numbers, dude!”

name: Kagamidai Boy B
message: “What can we do? What? These little ladies are all so hostile. They seriously want us gone!”
The boys have taken some serious damage from feeling like fish out of water all morning.
I was in the same state before lunch, but now the soothing power of Amaha and Panditty has put me back in the game.
If Hayata was here, it would have been his place to say this—but he’s not.

name: Shingo
message: “We’ve got this, guys. We can tough it out.”
I look around them all, and firmly state my resolve.

name: Shingo
message: “We aren’t going to improve things like this. If we’re patient, mind our Ps and Qs, they’ll come around eventually.”

name: Kagamidai Boy B
message: “Do you... really think so?”

name: Shingo
message: “I really do.”
I do. Now I know that Yuihime has people like Amaha!

name: Airi
message: “Enough!”
—But hold on. At the moment, there’s exactly one person like Amaha—that being Amaha herself.
We get into the afternoon, and it’s another parade of pissing off the Yuihime ladies.

name: Airi
message: “Uryu!”

name: Shingo
message: “What? Me?!”

name: Airi
message: “Who else would I be shouting at?!”

name: Yuihime Girl A
message: “You’re clearly the leader of the boys, Uryu.”
It also seems like, as I’m the one always trying to buck the guys up...
The Yuihime girls are starting to see anything distasteful from the boys as coming from me.

name: Airi
message: “Really, why?! Tell me why someone like you is Sakuno’s brother!”
There’s a lot I’d like to fight back on about that point.
But I can’t risk speaking up.

name: Macchi
message: “Please, Sena. At times like this, I think we need to start from a place of discussion.”

name: Airi
message: “But that’s what’s so hard to do! How do we talk to these insensitive lumps?!”

name: Macchi
message: “Oh, I knew you wouldn’t listen to me! Aah, what hope do I have?”

name: Kagamidai Boy A
message: “Uryu, I’m so sorry! This one is all on me!”

name: Kagamidai Boy B
message: “Can you girls from Kagamidai back us up here please? You know we aren’t doing this on purpose!”

name: Kagamidai Girl B
message: “It’s more like... we’re finally seeing your true colors since we arrived at Yuihime.”
It’s starting to feel like we just have to accept whatever they say about us.
As I feared, there are far more downs in this place than ups.

name: Shingo
message: “—and that’s what Sena said.”
Over dinner, Sakuno has urged me to discuss the day at school.

name: Shingo
message: “It’s a tough one. Bringing together a group of such different people.”
I eat some more of the potatoes, adding that somber comment.
I don’t really want to upset her.
And we’re primarily talking about Sena, who is Sakuno’s newest friend.
I don’t want her to start holding anything against Sena.

name: Shingo
message: “Mm.”

name: Sakuno
message: “What?”

name: Shingo
message: “These potatoes.”

name: Sakuno
message: “The potatoes are delicious.”

name: Shingo
message: “How’s your class, Sakuno? Are things difficult?”

name: Sakuno
message: “1-T is pretty peaceful.”
Sakuno replies with her usual easygoing tone, eating the same potatoes as me.

name: Sakuno
message: “Scoff, scoff... these are good. And I cooked them.”

name: Shingo
message: “Yeah, delicious. You cook root veggies well, Sakuno.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Oh, it’s nothing.”

name: Sakuno
message: “The Yuihime girls seem pretty welcoming. Maybe because I’m a girl.”

name: Shingo
message: “That might be a small part of it.”
Surely one part of it—but also, there’s no Sena in 1-T.
But no. I push away from thinking like that, even if I’m not sharing it.

name: Sakuno
message: “The boys might have it harder.”
Sakuno looks at me intently.

name: Sakuno
message: “But you’ll be fine.”

name: Sakuno
message: “You can handle women, Shingy.”

name: Shingo
message: “No, no, no, hold on!”
I wave my hand in front of my face.

name: Shingo
message: “I’m not the playboy type.”

name: Sakuno
message: “That’s not what I mean.”
Sakuno’s tone is as measured as a metronome.

name: Sakuno
message: “You live with me, Shingy.”

name: Shingo
message: “Ah. Yes, well, maybe that makes sense.”
Realizing what Sakuno is trying to say, I relax a little and nod.

name: Shingo
message: “Yeah, that’s true. You’re my sister, but you are a girl, Sakuno.”

name: Sakuno
message: “I’d be your brother if I was a boy.”
Sakuno gives a nod too. She still sounds like a metronome.

name: Shingo
message: “What you mean is—I should interact with the Yuihime girls like I interact with you.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Just be yourself, Shingy.”
She makes a good point. Sakuno is a girl. Just act like I act with her.

name: Shingo
message: “...I’ll help wash up.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Thanks.”
Sakuno gives a small laugh.

name: Sakuno
message: “You’re good at helping out, Shingy.”

name: Shingo
message: “All thanks to you—and you just got me to say all sorts of things, huh.”
But still...

name: Shingo
message: “Huh?”
After my evening meal, I’m relaxing in my room.
Sakuno comes casually in, picks a spot to sit down, opens a book, and starts reading.
It all looks so smooth and natural because she does this a lot.
She prefers my room to her own, apparently. Even if she doesn’t need me for anything, she often comes into my room like this.

name: Shingo
message: “...Hmmm.”

name: Shingo
message: “I was thinking, the way you invite yourself inside like this, you aren’t really like other girls.”
Sakuno looks up at me.

name: Sakuno
message: “I’m not like Airi?”

name: Shingo
message: “That’s a given.”
Sakuno feels natural when she looks at me. Unassuming. Sena is colder, and harsher. It’s like she’s shooting a freeze ray from her eyes.

name: Shingo
message: “But I don’t think it’s just her. You’re different from most girls, Sakuno.”
Sakuno lowers her head and thinks for a moment.

name: Sakuno
message: “...Yeah.”
She gives a slow nod and then starts reading again.

name: Airi
message: “Hello. This is Sena.”

name: Sakuno
message: “It’s me.”

name: Airi
message: “Hey, Sakuno...”
The call I hurried to pick up was from my new friend, Sakuno.
I’m happy she decided to call but also nervous about what she might say.
I’ve got images of her brother in the back of my mind.

name: Sakuno
message: “Sorry, I called you again.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Are you out?”

name: Airi
message: “Yep. Same as yesterday.”
Sakuno has the same light tone I’ve always heard her use.
Hearing that really puts me at ease. It seems like everything that happened today hasn’t soured our relationship.
—But then I wonder. Why would that put me at ease?
Am I feeling guilty about what went down?

name: Airi
message: “Just be careful about your phone bill. You might start regretting all these calls when you see it.”

name: Sakuno
message: “If it’s money spent talking to you, Airi, I don’t think I could regret that.”

name: Airi
message: “...You know just what to say.”
She’s cute, I have to give her that.
She doesn’t say much, but when she does speak I find her words often make a deep impression.
That’s one of the reasons we’ve become so close so quickly.

name: Airi
message: “Well, seeing as you’ve been kind enough to call, you can keep me company until I get home again.”

name: Sakuno
message: “I’m here for the ride.”

name: Airi
message: “Hey, I did just see a little outfit that I think would look great on you, Sakuno. You know that place—”
I walk through the evening, chatting to Sakuno on the phone.

name: Airi
message: “—and it would really suit your frame, you are so slender. What do you think?”

name: Sakuno
message: “Yeah. That sounds nice.”
Even Sakuno’s filler comments feel good.
She doesn’t use them often, and they remain simple, but she picks her timing perfectly and really hits the mark.
The conversation just bubbles along when chatting to Sakuno.
...So long as I keep other things out of my head.
“Like how it was exactly the same when chatting with Uryu—before everything else happened.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Airi, are you lost in thought?”

name: Airi
message: “Huh?! Ah, well, you know...”

name: Airi
message: “...Just thinking about how... conversation with you bubbles along so nicely...”

name: Sakuno
message: “You have a silver tongue yourself.”

name: Airi
message: “Hey, quit it! That’s kinda embarrassing.”

name: Airi
message: “I’m not normally one to compliment people like that, okay? It’s you’re the one dragging it out of me!”

name: Sakuno
message: “Hehehe.”
Just chatting about nothing like this is so much fun. I can’t put my finger on it, but I feel so comfortable around her.
Whatever the reason, the conversation bubbles. That’s the word for it.
But then bubbles—are also going to pop, eventually.
Keeping it going means you need more bubbles to bubble up from below.
Some new topic. Something we haven’t talked about yet. It seems inevitable.

name: Airi
message: “How is... Yuihime? I know you’ve only had two days, but are you settling in?”

name: Sakuno
message: “It’s a shame you’re a student there, but we aren’t in the same year. I wish we were the same age!”
And the next thing to bubble up is school life. I knew it was coming, although I’ve been avoiding it.
—Why? Why would I avoid this?

name: Airi
message: “I know. I wanted to be your classmate too, Sakuno.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Sounds like things are harder in the second year.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Shingo has talking.”

name: Airi
message: “...Yeah, I guess things are hard.”
And so we start talking about him.
—That’s why I was avoiding this.
And yet I’m the one who started this topic.
She’s my friend, and I want to get some stuff off my chest. That’s where this is all coming from.
I don’t have the easiest personality. I’ll happily admit that.
Not that I would ever seek to change it. I don’t want to lose my footing.
I need to remain stable.

name: Airi
message: “...Let me apologize again for surprising you like that on the first day.”

name: Sakuno
message: “And you’re still against the merger?”

name: Airi
message: “Pretty much. I’m sorry, Sakuno, but I just don’t want boys around.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Even Shingo?”

name: Airi
message: “Yes, even Shin—even Uryu.”
For a moment I almost say “Shingy” myself.
A clear indication of the convoluted feelings I have towards him.

name: Airi
message: “...No, that’s not true. It’s not ‘even Uryu’—it’s primarily him. I’m not sure how to put it...”

name: Airi
message: “I can’t keep my cool around him.”
That’s it.
I can’t keep my cool.

name: Airi
message: “Because I met you two before the provisional merger.”
And because he’s Sakuno’s brother.
In some sense, I feel like I have a connection with him, but we barely know each other directly at all.

name: Airi
message: “...That’s why having someone like him so close, on my home turf, is unsettling me.”
That’s why I’m pushing back so hard.
Pushing back against this situation.

name: Sakuno
message: “...What about me?”

name: Airi
message: “It’s different for you, Sakuno. We’re both girls.”

name: Sakuno
message: “...Yeah.”
I give a sigh.
I know that “both girls” part is difficult too. I know it too well.
But that just makes it even harder, having boys around. That part definitely isn’t limited to just Uryu.

name: Airi
message: “...Hey, Sakuno.”

name: Airi
message: “Why do you think boys even exist?”

name: Sakuno
message: “...Because there are girls?”
I give another sigh. There’s no doubting her logic there.
...Men, and women.
No matter how I try to resist, I’m a woman, which keeps me aware of the existence of men.

name: Airi
message: “...I wish gender didn’t exist.”

name: Sakuno
message: “You want us to all be mewomen?”

name: Airi
message: “...Too hard to say. That’s probably why they split us up.”
